title: Economy of Germany
summary: The economy of Germany is a highly developed social market economy.[20] It has the largest national economy in Europe, the fourth-largest by nominal GDP in the world, and fifth by GDP (PPP). In 2017, the country accounted for 28% of the euro area economy according to the International Monetary Fund (IMF).[21] Germany is a founding member of the European Union and the Eurozone.[22][23]
